confirmed_facts: Fire broke out at 2:50â€¯pm local time on 26â€¯Novemberâ€¯2025 in a highâ€‘rise apartment complex in Taiâ€¯Po, Hongâ€¯Kong.
At least 13 people died, including one firefighter, and about 10 people were injured.
The building had 2,000 units and housed approximately 4,800 residents; 7 of the 8 blocks were engulfed by the fire.
Bamboo scaffolding used for maintenance work was present and contributed to the fireâ€™s rapid spread.
Firefighters classified the incident as a levelâ€‘5 fire and are conducting rescue operations.
